name: clover seed production, Swiss integrated production, at farm | clover seed, Swiss integrated production, at farm | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9905/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of clover seed (fresh matter). The yield is 400 kg/ha at a moisture content at storage of 10%.;;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

This activity assumes co-production of clober seeds and forage on an intensive temporary meadow during one year. Included in the dataset are (a)  those operations which can be explicitly attributed to seed production and (b) other inputs and the emissions with a share of 50% of the burden of the whole production system, attributing the other 50% to forage production. The activity starts with the soil cultivation and sowing after the harvest of the previous crop. The inputs of seeds, mineral fertilisers and pesticides are considered. Farm manure as an organic fertiliser is only accounted for in terms of direct field emissions; all pre-processes are included in the animal production systems.


The dataset includes all machine operations and corresponding machine infrastructure and sheds. Machine operations are: sowing, fertilisation, pest control, harvest, transport from field to regional processing center (10 km) and drying of seeds. No ploughing is included as the crop is sown in direct seeding under a cover crop This activity ends after drying of the seeds at the regional processing center.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0119:Growing of other non-perennial crops

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Values refer to the situation in Switzerland.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data derived from literature, recommendations and expert information

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of clover seed, Swiss integrated production, at farm is calculated to be circa 5.00E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.00E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'clover seed, Swiss integrated production, at farm' is calculated to be circa 3.88E-01 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 7.75E-01 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

Only output of seed considered. Input of seed fully attributed to seed production. Modelled,see chapter 'CO2 binding' in '01_crop production_direct field emissions and natural resources_v1.0.pdf' - pdf-document on the dedicated talk page of ecoinvent (www.ecoinvent.org/documentation)
